results.title: Metamorphoses (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a clown who is so versatile that he even juggles himself. One moment the clown stands tossing balls, the next he becomes dismembered, following the balls about on the screen but coming together again all in one piece to finish the act. The film is in the genre of Norman McLaren and is without words.

results.title: Metamorphoses
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Conestoga College and Faroun Films
results.brief_description: A bored white collar office worker finds meaning in the 25 second elevator ride to his office. In this secret time alone, he progresses from simply undressing to his shorts (and then re-dressing) to a multitude of relaxing pass-times, all at ultrafast speed. One day the lift gets stuck and later opens to reveal a much older man apparently dead of old age. (Won Palm D’Or, Cannes, 1976.)

results.title: Metals
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg shows the different properties of metals, illustrates their characteristics, demonstrates the crystalling structure of aluminium, and shows how the same piece of metal can have different properties according to treatment. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Metallurgist
results.creator_credit: Neville Bletcher, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Solarchrome
results.brief_description: Describes the work of a metallurgist and depicts various activities in which his skill is needed; in particular, the manufacture and testing of tin plate.

results.title: Metallica: Freeze 'Em All
results.brief_description: On December 8, 2013, Metallica created history by playing a show for fans and research scientists at the Carlini Argentine Base in Antarctica.

results.title: Metalization service
results.brief_description: First in the filed of spray coating - electric art spraying of metals to repair and new surfaces of metals - shows techniques and applications of various components and compounds.

results.title: Metal in harmony
results.creator_credit: Kenneth J. Fairbairn and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: Illustrates how aluminium is created, and indicates how much the metal is needed in the modern world. The basic raw material is mined in Ghana then shipped to Scotland, were hydro-electric power is available to create aluminium - a metal which is a skilful blend of ingredients.

results.title: Messengers of the Gods
results.brief_description: The story of the crane and its long flight in the imagination of man. Looks at their migration habits, courtship, mating, nesting and feeding rituals. This is a nature documentary of extraordinary quality with eloquent narration.
results.description: The story of the crane and its long flight in the imagination of man. Looks at their migration habits, courtship, mating, nesting and feeding rituals. This is a nature documentary of extraordinary quality with eloquent narration.

results.title: Messengers of peace.- [Rev. ed.]
results.creator_credit: Al Fox and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: This film looks at the philatelic aspects of United Nations’ stamps. The UN has a postal administration and used the mail routes of the world for its won unique international postage stamps. Some of the world’s leading artists prepare the designs which appear on the stamps.
